newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX to trade some DTB contracts from 1998.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX to trade some DTB contracts from 1998.

text.p: The Singapore International Monetary Exchange (SIMEX) said in a statement it had signed a linkage agreement with the Deutsche Terminborse (DTB) to trade some of DTB's futures and options contracts.
"Subject to regulatory approvals in Singapore and Germany, both exchanges are working towards having the linkage arrangement put in place by March 31, 1998," the statement said.
However, a SIMEX official later told a news conference the agreement could be signed "much earlier."

The statement said the agreement "gives SIMEX the exclusive right to trade DTB's Bund and BOBL futures and options as well as the SCHATZ futures contracts on the floor of SIMEX during its open outcry hours."

Under the agreement, the contracts traded on the SIMEX floor will be fungible with the identical contracts traded at DTB. All contracts traded at SIMEX will be transferred at the end of each trading day to DTB's clearing house for clearing.
